Name: Tanvi
Review Title: Good phone but bad sound quality
Review: Short one day review for Oneplus Nord2 8GB/128Phone works very smoothly, no lagsBattery drains at a normal rateWarp charger (65W) charges the phone 100% in 25mins-1/2 an hourGood camera - needs to be checked outside to know moreNo audio jackseparate button on right side of the phone for alerts - adjust phone on Silent/ Vibrate/ GeneralPhone is a bit heavyFingerprint sensor works properly, no lagsSound is sufficiently loudOverall a good phoneWhat i didn't like is the sound quality.  When I listened to music through the earphones i felt unpleasant and it was piercing my earbuds and the experience was very bad. Although everything else is good but the bad sound quality is what I can't bear with. One plus has compromised on the sound quality for this phone

Name: HEMANT SHARMA
Review Title: First day review: Buy now; regret later
Review: Day one : Instant regretIs there anything to like about this phone?I don't know if I've been scammed or oneplus has deteriorated. The only reason I bought this phone was camera.I had Poco F1 (adware and bloatware cleared) and Nord 2 stands no where close to F1. I went thru a series of traumatic episodes while clicking thru the camera modes and it's results. Immediately I applied for return but there poped up several clauses for item brought thru exchange. Now I have no option but to sit and cry for the wrong decision I made. And yes!! this phone plugged in for charging can evaporated my tear drops as well. Play heavy games and  turn this phone into heater.Things I like on this phone:Smooth scrolling.Oxygen OS is clean though.Phone case included.Overall: Don't buy, not kiddingEdit: An explode incident is circulating in social media. This phone heats up dangerously. I wish I could get a refund.

Name: Sridhar
Review: Under 30k gives you the best flagship experience. Battery lasts 17 hrs as said Camera quality is superb. The only issue you might want to be concerned is with the recent blasts of the phone but be assured it is most likely due to lack of how to use the 65W warp charger. It is very fast which charges 90% in 20 mins. So heat is generated. Advised not to overcharge or use phone when charging. If you keep safety as priority then go forr MI 11x

Name: Vivek
Review Title: Awesome phone in this price segment
Review: Worth your 29999The best part of this phone is charging it charged within 30 min. If you want to keep your battery healthy please charge phone between 15-20% To 85-90% never charge 100.This phone gives you the best charging speed,Camera awesome, 1200 AI equals to 870 SD, OIS WORKING PERFECTLYusing for last 4 days no issues were faced.Screen is really fluid as they said.Overall if you want to buy a phone with class in 30K and with exchangeJUST CLOSE YOUR EYES AND GO FOR IT.

Name: Nifran
Review: This is the best OnePlus Nord 2 edition. After discount I got this phone for 34999 and it's worth it. The phone looks more premium than 9r and other Nord editions. Good battery pack up (after restricting background activities under battery app management I get around 6 to 7 hours screen on time). Camera during day time is does job and during time night it's good if you hold on the phone for longer time while you takes pics on night mode.

Name: Anurag Uikey
Review Title: Power packed and Value for money
Review: Simply Flagship killer from One plus. Fast , smooth and flawless operating system. Decent camera and sound quality. Overall enriched with features and value for money. Thanks amazon for fast delivery.

Name: Mohd Farooq Khan
Review Title: Review Revised: Good Phone with Decent Value for Money
Review: Returned first unit due to very poor battery (used to charge 2 times/day), now new one requires charging 1.5 days which is decent enough considering high end motherboard.PROS:1) Good for first time buyers of Oneplus series who have not used Canvas option in Always on Display2) Snappy phone with fast response due to Dimensity 1200 Chipset is superb but battery draining3) Supported by Quick Android updates4) Charging time due to WARP charging is super and generally charges in 40 mins +/- 5 minsKEY to charging: Even after full charge (100%) it require some more charging and only when it shows Charged, only then discharge (Check Battery section and observe status)CONS:1) Battery life is never been its forte however WARP Charge fill this gap by providing extremely fast charging (BTW my second model (after returning first unit) providing better battery backup 1 to 1.5 days for complete discharge.2) Battery is 4500 mAH plus but it is good for nothing and charger is of huge size actually people should put the photo of charger and then understand how impossible to carry this abnormally big charger everywhere.3) Abnormal charging rate, sometimes takes 30 mins, sometimes takes 40 mins, sometimes even taken 50 mins. On top of it WARP charging really deteriorates the battery and ultimately kills it before its half life.4) No doubt it is color OS and not Oxygen OS (which is just pasted as skin on top of Color OS) so the unique charm of having Oneplus mobile is somehow gone after merger with OPPO

Name: TechSavvy
Review: OnePlus Nord 2 Vs Poco F3Day 3:So I watched lot of videos before finalizing for this one. All videos said that Poco F3 and 1+ Nord are same with minor differences.So as 1+ sound far better name and brand than poco, I decided to go for 1+. I have been 1+ fan since 1+1 launch.Verdict: Poco F3 would have been better.  (As I used F1 for 3 years & previous 1+1 & 1+6).Issues:Finger print sensor is slowCamera quality is good but macro & zoom focus is very badFace recognition rarely worksPhone is biggerPhone battery works for a day only (same as poco F1)Positive:Security seems betterNo irritating advt. Poco always seems to keep reading my data including contactsAuto unlock at home is good featureCharging is fastBottomline:If you want better brand name  : OnePlusIf you want better overall phone: Poco F3Edit: After 3 months of usage:Poco or other brand would have been better.- Google assistant doesn't work on lockscreen- if open mobile at night, it's too bright for sometime and then reduce the brightness- Bluetooth connectivity issueChasing OnePlus for support, but no response

Name: Shubhajit Roy
Review: Everything works very well. I just have some issues which are as follows:1. front camera, kinda hazy sometimes.2. Change of accent colors requires a bit more options.3. Monochrome sensor is good for nothing 😂, could have given a macro there.Although most of the improvements can be done via updates.(*can't change the camera sensor though). So overall, a very promising device.I personally opted for this device because I used to own OnePlus 3 and it worked for 5 years. And I have other devices like earbuds, TV of OnePlus as well. Along with that, OnePlus gives me good customer service and frankly, it listens to the customer. Many a times I asked OnePlus for a feature in my OnePlus 3 and it was given in the updates.(*others also asked for it). Because of all these reasons I felt OnePlus Nord 2 is a very good device for its price.

Name: Denver Saldanha
Review Title: Phone is great, but read before you buy!
Review: The phone is great performance-wise. The battery is average, but the 65W fast charging will surprise you. The front camera is a 32mp camera but isn't good under low light conditions. Back camera is good enough!If you just want great performance with good enough battery that will last you a day and you are not a selfie addict then go for it! It wont disappoint you. Design is also really good and premium

Name: Sandeep
Review: One plus team has really done a good job, really appreciate the premium look and finish at first glance. Fabulous camera at this price point, amazing oxygen os experience, better speakers. Yes, the phone does get a bit warm but nothing uncomfortable. Double thumbs up!!After a couple of days of usage.1. Face unlock is just top notch.2. Fingerprint reader might be slow by a fraction of a millisecond but I really don't mind.3. I can bet that it has one of the best camera in this segment.4. Awesome performance. I tested the new chipset on a lot of games (bgmi, cod, nfs) at high settings and I didn't see any frame drop anytime.5. I didn't feel a need for a120Hz display as it offers a silky smooth and super responsive display. Didn't really face low brightness issue outdoors.6. Warp charging this phone is a whole new level of experience and is probably the fastest in phones at this price point. Battery drains a bit sooner but it's absolutely justified for a device of such capability.7. I've used the in box cover so it helped block the heat during long hours of usage. Hopefully, the issue would get resolved with future software updates.Worth it!!

Name: Sanat T
Review: Got the 12GB ram variant. This is a decent phone. My previous phone was OnePlus 5T and coming from that I feel like this phone is kind of a disappointment. The width of the phone is a bit too thin for my liking but whatever. Another thing i hate is the software but in my defense i didnt know it has gotten this bad since then though.For pros, I love the buttons feel very clicky and responsive. The 65w charger is amazing, my laptop also uses a 65w type c charger so I don't have to carry extra charger around. The alert slider is easy to slide compared to the 5T but I got used to it. Haptic feedback is much better as well.Overall a bit disappointed especially in software and width of the phone, everything else feels good.

Name: Naveen
Review: Camera is not up to the mark, performance wise it's extraordinary phone

Name: Anil Kumar Singh
Review: Very disappointed with the kind of mobile device provided by One Plus. I understand this is not their flagship product but at least it should be good enough to suffice our day-to-day needs when it is being priced at 30K. Issues that I have faced with this phone:1. Slide-up functionality is not working from the home screen.2. Defective microphone provided. It only works when I switch to a phone speaker.3. Frequent loss of mobile network and unable to connect calls. It gets resolves only I re-start my phone.Did not get much support from Amazon also. From the day I purchased this phone, it took almost 10 days for Amazon to understand that this is a defective phone that they have provided. I followed up with them on daily basis and have to be on call for at least an hour in order to make them understand the issue. And after all this pain they have not refunded the complete amount. I have exchanged my previous phone and did not get the full refund of it as it was non-refundable.Key points:1. Never go for One Plus Nord 2.2. Amazon will make you crazy in order to get a refund. (If replacement is not available)

Name: Raviteja
Review: Good mobile, but not up to the mark with the price tag 30k not worth.I feel my privious mobile Nokia 8.1 was more premium than this OnePlus Nord 2.This mobile is for long term, after using for 2 days I feel after few software updates we get to know how exactly the it perform.I have used it at a stretch watching YouTube contact at HD, FHD and 4K, and with contact reading, attending the calls, going through the specifications, and doing with all the daily stuff it gave me battery about 8+ hour on screen time and chargers within 40 minutes from 0 to 100.Coming to pros and cons,Pros:1) Built Quality and design, simple and elegant(Strictly for working professionals).2) Touch very smooth.3) Camera, picture and video quality is very good.4) Stereo Speakers very loud and clear.5) Call quality is very good.6) Battery lasts for good 8+ hour on screen time.7) Charges very fast within 40 minutes.8) Played few games Asphalt 9 really gave me good feel.9) Ram management was good.10) Bluetooth connectivity is quite fast.11) 2 years OS updates and 3 years software updates.Cons:1) Sometimes heats even with normal usage(it may clear with software update)2) I don't feel the processor is really that powerful, MD 1200 AI it's not up to the mark on this device.3) It takes lot of time to boot when it gets restart, loading the games or apps.4) Not for heavy gamers, please avoid if you are thinking to buy it for playing games.5) Benchmarks are really very poor on this device when I had checked with my mobile, kindly check what OnePlus team had mentioned while launching this mobile(check picture attached)Over all this is a value for money if you buy it for long term like 3 to 4 years usage.Check my Nord 2 battery over on attachment.This is my 2 days experience only, it may varied user to user.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: Received defective phone. Amazon replaced my phone after a week. But again same problem started
Review:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   I am writing this review after one week use of phone. Phone looks and features are as defined but I received a defective one. Phone camera is is not working. Selfie photos are not opening from que. Also phone has hitting problem. I have requested for technician inspection and replacement.Technical finally came and initiated replacement. I received a brand new same phone. Thank you AnazonBut again same problem started in new one. Really frustrated with one plus this Nord2 model

Name: Jitendra kumar
Review: Worst camera experience and higher battery drainage.

Name: SANJIB MAITRA
Review: Mind blowing..

Name: RajSS
Review: Only problem is battery draining fast(5-6 SOT).No bugs, no lag, camera quality  drastically improved but ultra wide is pretty avg and what i dislike is slightly red tinted in 50mp non hrd image processing, fast and smooth. Everything is good.

Name: Hansraj
Review Title: They are not picking up the defective Product
Review:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   After update the device is not going to Start and instantly I reported it to Amazon and request a return. But till now it’s about 15 days gone but they are not going to pick up.#DepressedNo one is listening to my problem.

Name: Nitin
Review: This phone has a very good balance of all the features.1. Camera : Camera is good with nice colour reproduction. Photos come out clean and it's dependable in low light conditions as well.2. Battery : Battery backup is decent, not the best of all but it's good enough for an average person. A fast charging is always good to have and it charges in 20 minutes from 20 percent to 80 percent which is the average charging circle for me.3. Screen : 90 Hz screen is actually more than enough for an average user like me. Backed up with good haptics, it makes the experience good.4. Connectivity : 5G is certainly something which we will see later but for now it supports Career aggregation. Call quality is not right there as my iPhone but much better than average android phones.5. Speakers : It's like a mini soundbox. Truly loved it's speakers.Alert slider is a cherry on top.With a dependable service centres and a good software.It's the best phone out there at 30000. Go for it without a doubt.

Name: Viraj mojar
Review: Phone is hanging after 20 days of use, lag issie after restart...do not know if this is a fault in single piece or overall...this is not the. Quality i expected from one plus. How can some one identify if the phone is functioning properly in 7 days of delivery . That is what happened with me ...the cell phone performance was observed in 15 to 20 days. Wish i still had the option of replacement of this device with a new one.

Name: Jagdish G.
Review: I writings this review after one month use. This phone beast in terms of charging, Camera quality and price. This one is almost close to flagship phone. What I most like there are no pre installed apps in phone. I have till did not face any lagging and this phone is charge (0-100%) in just 30-35 min.Cons:-1) Charger is bigger than socket, sometimes it overlap switch while charging2) there is only digital zoom, not an optical zoom which is little disappoint me.

Name: VIKRAM CHARAN
Review: I ordered Oneplus Nord2 from amazon on 6th August 2021, after using the phone for two days, a lot of issues came up in the phone, after checking this regard from amazon, amazon sent the technical engineer , he  fully agreed and said that the phone must be written back.OnePlus Nord 2 5G (Blue Haze, 12GB RAM, 256GB Storage) software is full of bugs. (Bill attached)Bad experience with this from the moment it was received.Mobile hangs and slow during the initial startup.Device not working properly and restarts several times automatically.App clone is not working and I have the apps on my mobile. It is mentioned in the app clone but it doesn't show anything to clone.Normal whatsapp chat drive backup not working... My old whatsapp backups are gone😡😡😡.It was a Very bad and worst experience with a OnePlus..Photo access from the gallery is very slow. If one is having hundreds of photos in a gallery then pictures take time to load when scrolling through them. Even my previous 2 year old phone fared way better. Software optimization is lacking.

Name: Prajwal Sharma
Review: This is the product with beautiful design, better core and beautiful display. But it is almost 4 weeks I am using this phone and seen some major problem and think this might be the reason it explored1.) Fast charging- it's charge really fast but  if u touch ur phone back it is super hot.2.) Heavy usage can effect the performance and heatup the phone3.) Camera is really good from other phone but wide angle and primary phone is not as well4.) Don't use this phone during charging or after changing at least 5 mins

Name: Nagaraju
Review Title: Not recommended to buy from Amazon
Review: Phone is slow compared to Iq007 and even camera performance is poor compared to iq007. Also Amazon exchange is scam. Even if there is a small scratch on old phone the Amazon agents reject your phone. I mean why would I exchange a brand new phone, used phones will have wear and tear. Don't buy.

Name: Din
Review: Heating problemBattery draining too fast.Need to charge twice for normal use. Not recommended

Name: Anish Anand
Review Title: Great phone for daily use. Amazing Phone
Review: I got this phone under an exchange offer of Rs 8000 for iphone7 (6 years old). After a vigourous use i thought to review this phone some how as it actually blew my mind.First is the screen ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Damn impressed. I dont know the process rate but its damn responsive and fast. Very Good. Big enough to enjoy any video. The pixel clearity and the brightness will definitely fall you in love with this handset.Then comes the Sound quality. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Gives a crispy clear, balanced & surround sound. And the volume is LOUD.The Battery charger ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ one gets a 65 watt charger with in the box and its damn fast. My first 100% charge took 20 mins from 38%Camera ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Lovely digital and video captures. Outstanding. Ultimate clearity both in day and night. Obviously not as pro like but definitely not less than that.Interface ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ clean and easy. Took me minutes to get used to eat.Battery ⭐⭐⭐⭐ is amazing, does not drains fast, but this some what wont please hardcore gamers. Watching daily series on this or doing daily chores are perfect with this kind of battery.Phone cover & Tampered Glass cover ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ comes along with a rough and tough signature one plus cover and a pre-fixed tampered glass.8GB Rom 128GB RAM ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐No heating at all ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐Over all im bowled with One Plus handset again. No more iphone for me again my life for sure. This the best smartphone for sure ♥️♥️♥️♥️

Name: Amazon Customer
Review: So firsofall I am not gonna give a review the way those youtubers give. I am just gonna give a honest review which a lay man (non-techy) person can understand.The phone, battery life, display, processor and camera performance is just beyond par excellence. There is no phone that gives you this type of performance. Even the Oneplus 9R and Oneplus 8 are not this good.The highlight is the 65W charger which charges your phone to 100% in just 15 minutes. The phone is sturdy and looks great in your hand. Camera at 50 mp and Selfie with 32 mp is just amazing. There is no issue of phone heating up or any smartware or bloatware as such.Now let me come to the bad part.When you start your phone, it asks for permissions on all apps including your camera and your gallery, which means they (china) have access to all your pictures so you are risk of photos getting viral.Also you have to give permission to view data/pictures/chats else the camera/whatsapp will not work. If you read the conditions carefully is also says that Oneplus in HQ (China) can share this data/pictures with whomever they want and you can't hold this against them. So this is the scary part which I didn't like.Do remember to check the Oneplus Nord 2 review video on youtube posted by geeky ranjit. He has done an in dept analysis about the pros and cons of the phone.Honestly I dint wanna go for a Chinese brand and was deciding between Oppo Reno 6 which is priced at little lesser at 29,990/- but I thot for a little more money if I am getting phone which will last me for a good 5-6 years then why not put in an investment. With Oppo I wasn't sure about the durability.You can go for it if you have the budget of 35K but make sure you don't save any private pics in your gallery.

Name: Isha
Review: I bought 12gb ram model. Writing this review after using phone for 15days.I dnt think this is flagship killer, it should be treated equivalent to mediocre to redmi phones. I hvae also bought note10 pro max  at sametime for family. Comparing to that I dnt feel the price OnePlus charge is justified.- Camera is really bad. It over saturate the image and processing makes photos look really bad.Note10 pro max camera stands out and it really has flagship camera.This is where OnePlus lagged largely.30k phone with camera like 10k phone.- Only criteria where it excels is battery charge 65w, but that is now coming with basics phone within 20k price band.33w od other redmi phone is also not bad.-And gaming people can buy nord2 but personally I still donot prefer mediatek anytime above Snapdragon.- Speakers and display , nothing special looks same like any other amoled display in any ordinary phone.- No 3.5mm jack, learn from redmi and realme how to fit in best way.-Now all that 5g noise, does anyone think they are going to keep this phone for 3-4years waiting for someone to launch 5g. We are still not able to use 4g or 4g+ to  benefit.Why pay premium for feature you will probably never use.Take informed decision...

Name: Elite Engineer
Review: Don't buy this scary device

Name: Pritam Sadhu
Review Title: Could be better if they improve battery section
Review: Using Nord 2 5G almost 1 month and here is my feedback:I am very happy with this device except the battery. Battery of 4500 mAh is not good at all though you will have 65W charger which can charge in 35 mins. But that will reduce your battery life cycle count.Initially there were lot of software bugs but I have received 3 updates in a month and almost all gone.For the Netflix  no HDR support there. HDR+ available on YouTube. Here Netflix needs to add this in supported device list.Call Quality is perfect.VoLTE working fine for Vi and AirTel and VoWiFi also working for Vi and Airtel.Rear camera is superb but front could be better but not major issue.120 Hz screen refresh rate is missing in this budget may be that is for 9Rt.

Name: Kartick Hazra
Review Title: Not So better and useful from Past Honor 15 k Phone
Review: After using one month I am just Going to mentioned that my Honor 8x was too good compare to this phone software and few hardware (except added Hardware)1. No NPU unit its really unexpected2. When wifi enable voice call is just worst and breaking voice3. Call quality is not so good over Cell and 4G compare to my Honor 8x was far excellent4. UI Customization not good compare to my Honor 8x was far excellent5. No Customize animation on UI on screen slide6. On screen Fingerprint has no 360 activated feature that can unlock from any angle where compare to my Honor 8x was doing the same from back finger touch and fast7. Cannot block app network usage from background  individually8. Photo Glary has no many feature like pop up menu details even hanging9. Vivid color and display not like Actual Amoled screen type except refresh rate because in day out not so much brighter on direct sunlight10. Front camera  lagging with displayIts not like a 35K phone its just like a 15k Phoneand the brand taking all money without quality check as expected on this PricePlease stop doing business  in India by selling your Product with this someOne+ must have to look on thisAn the customer  service people only knows to reset the phonethat should no be the good practice , they must escalate to the developer and technical about the product review from customer to make it far better  and service

Name: Bhushan Matonkar
Review: I like using one plus smartphones.Im the user of one plus 2 with 4 years of usage.Recently upgraded with one plus Nord 2 5G as one plus 2 was left without any  updates from one plus.Nord 2 built , camera ,battery is value for money however the ultra wide camera quality is on the downside.One plus might improve it with future updates.Im a fan of monocrome sensor now.The battery charging speed technology is good.Overall user experience is satisfactory with the device.Keep it up "ONEPLUS"

Name: Yash Thakur
Review Title: It's the one for a modern day socio-gamer,
Review: Primary camera undeniably fantasticnight 🌃 mode is amazingHDR image is goodStabilization is greatSelfie shooter is goodWide cam is just okIs there any other camera 😑(mono-worst)Performance is great when efficiency mode turned onBattery when efficiency mode turned off is bout 6 hrs of sotCharging 0-100 in 32 minsDisplay is good outdoors but there is some problems seeing under direct sunlightColours are good and viewing angles are great90hz is just same as 120 no big differenceTouch response rate shall be increasedBuild quality is good as of glass and plastic sandwich.Bgmi works fine no frame dropNo 90 FPS but u can use config file to enable.That's it folksHope it helps u to make decision,😄(3 days review)

Name: Vanshika
Review Title: Pretty much everything you can ask for
Review: I've been using this phone from last four months and I now finally decided to write a review about it. Before you proceed to read my review, here's something you should know, if you're looking for a good aesthetic phone, go for it. I'm a minimal user. My main requirements were photography and smooth performance. I don't play games or perform heavy duty. I do basic reel editing. And I believe this was the perfect phone I could get. It's a full package. It gives instagram ready shots. The night shots are just supreme. I might as well rate its night photography above day one. For a basic user like me, it's a win. The front camera is a charmer too. This is my first ever experience with OnePlus and I'm not disappointed at all. Though I was little suspicious amidst blasting cases but then again I've been using it for four months and it is doing really well so I don't fear about it anymore.My advice? If you're basic user like me who wants good aesthetic shots, go for it.

Name: Ramesh Babu
Review Title: Didnt like the O.S at all >Review after a month
Review: I was waiting to buy this phone in first sale bcoz of the hype over its features and finally got it. And im really surprised why people are crazy abt oneplus phones. The O.S is not tht great and not so user friendly. the basic things like1) Dialer app - there is no full screen image coming for incoming callers. if u want to search for a contact  U need to scroll down to go to specific alphabet  or u need to search in search bar.There is no side bar with alphabets given  where u can directly jump to the specific alphabet in contacts app.2) messages - im unable to find whether the message came from sim 1 or sim 2 & also u need to long press to change sim1/sim2 to send a message.3) calculator is pretty basic without any converters like currency,date,age ,speed etc.4) there is no automatic call recording option. if u press call recording after a call starts, it will say automated voice to both callers " this call is being recorded'' .which is shocking5)Battery drains faster for normal usage without even playing games. however it takes only 30 mins for 0-100 % or u just need 10 mins if u have 40% already which is big plus.6) 32 mpx front camera with sony sensor is not really great. i have redmi note 5 pro which deliver better selfies than this.back camera is ok with HDR. without HDR it makes skin wrinkly. i wonder why??7) on whatsapp video calls front camera is not at all good. i have fiber net speed connection but it makes my face look very wrinkled, and noisy. No clear face is coming.. i dont know why :(8)Screen casting to my VU TV  is not working at all . im still trying, but it makes phone freezing and i need to exit from screencast everytime. Never connected to tv.  its  just me or everyone?? if u think these are all network issues, its running smoothly with my old redmi note 5 pro mobile !!!? so its something related to mobile issue only.And using same wifi for all devices.9) NO themes available other than the system provided. u need to apply 5-6 themes which are default or need to change the wall paper for new look.10) Appclone (Dual apps) available only for insta,fb,messenger,telegram & whatsapp. u cant use other than these apps.11) there is no call recording folder found in file manager.After searching 30 mins i finally  able to listen . why though???these issues are O.S related which were never discussed in any youtube channels they all reviewed looks specs.....but these things are always annoying me in my daily use... Small things but why should i worry always...after all its ONEPLUS.... THE BIGG BRAND... its definitely over rated in my opinion .

Name: Dr.Kaushik J
Review: Very happy with the delivery by Amazon... hopeless battery...does not stay for even a day...fast charge gets to 100% in half hour but the 100% does not last even a day wit conservative use..makes me wonder if they're showing 50% as 100% in a make-believe operation....also the first news I read the day after buying the phone was about the phone explosion in bangalore...finally good luck trying to find a screen guard in the stores

Name: Srabanjit Guha
Review Title: Pathetic performance. Major heating issue, no support from oneplus
Review: Pathetic performance. Major heating issue, no support from oneplus..Have provided all debug report, necessary inputs to analyse the issue, not support from oneplus. Refer attached response after 1month followup.I have debugged by my own. Issues mainly in:1. GPU performance compatibility with processor.2. Over locked cpu caused over consumption of battery while using camera, videocall or net browse. Causing heating issue3. Lagging of power consumption optimization and 65w charger causes heat during chargeIf you still interested, after performing os update, go to advance settings and adjust refresh ratio to 90 hz and reduce GPU cycle. Switch off GPU performance logging and all other back end performance reporting logs. This actually may help you reducing the heating issue. But that's just a temp fix. OnePlus has to take care the problem seriously.

Name: Areeb
Review Title: Brilliant phone! Finally a good device by oneplus after launching pathetic phones like the 9 series
Review:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   Great phone under 30k!!! Consider it if you want a value for money phone that meets all expectations! That feeling owning a oneplus is anyday better than owning an iqoo vivo oppo poco!! Oxygen os apparently has some funtouch os touches but trust me oxygen os still is alive which itself is a reason why I went for this device!!! Kudos to oneplus

Name: Aishwarya S.
Review Title: Selfie cam is not up to the mark.
Review: The selfie camera is disappointing. Desaturated pictures, smoothes out everything even after beauty filter is off. Not very sharp and not real colours. Main camera is very good.

Name: Sagarkumar Pamula
Review Title: Please don't buy a Mediatek Density SoC mobiles
Review: OnePlus Nord 2 is accompanied with Mediatek Density 1200 SoC which is quite powerful in terms of organization producing it. I bought OnePlus Nord 2 (12GB RAM and 256 GB storage) through Amazon . I wanted to return this device but, the return policy for Amazon is 7 days only which made a loss of 9k for me. When it comes to performence first week was fine but, after 10 days it started showing its true nature. First, don't know why it started burning up at the processor side of the phone🔥. I thought of over usage may be but, I remember it neither I have used it to its maximum potential and also I am low key user. Second, while charging the device it started burning up again thought due to charging this happens but, I earlier used OnePlus 5, OnePlus 5T, Redmi Note 6 never faced such issue while charging and being a Mediatek Density SoC it shouldn't. Third, Ambient display feature is good but, drains your battery to a next level and the UI is not designed to show how much does this feature drains battery. Fourth, Proximity Sensors were not working at all which I got to know while I did a manual diagnosis of phone through OnePlus Care app. Conclusion: This phone is not at all a good choice for buying it with Mediatek Density SoC. If you have used Snapdragon then go for the same but don't buy Mediatek SoC mobiles at all. In the end I incurred a loss of 9k for getting rid of this phone through buy back feature which is a huge set back for android devices. Atleast OnePlus Center guys should have considered that device had issues but, the service center guy says with smile that we can't do anything submit your phone and take it back after 2 days. Any new phone buy back program should only reduce 20% of its initial price. This should be applicable to all devices in the country. Now, I own a Snapdragon 888 SoC OnePlus 9 Pro which is much more better than these low end version.Note: Please be aware of this never buy a budget phone because it is already compromised with the specifications and reduces it true value.

Name: §HÆĽ
Review: Awesome camera best charging speed and the most proper clutter free OS

Name: thulasidaran
Review: Bought this as a long pending replacement.  Per initial experience, I am impressed.-battery: Lasts more than a day with moderate use- Camera: great quality pictures. No grains when zooming in-charging: 15% to 100% in 15 mins, no heating issue. In general there is no heating issue with continuous usage too, which is great.performance: apps load superfast, no lags, touch response is great, overall impressed.the silicon case supplied with phone is of decent quality-it's ribbed structure protects camera and the screen, tempered glass is preapplied, so no need to buy these separately as of now.Good buy, to sum up.

Name: Faizan sheikh
Review Title: Mobile is good but getting heat a lot
Review: Monile is decent,runs smooth, display is good, charging is fastBut there are some cons which needs to keep in mind1. Software- trust me guys i was using oneplus 5 from last 4 year, but this nord software doesn't feel like you are using oxygen os, it feels cheap like other OS2) too much enhancement feeling cheap camera3) getting heat alot, if using continusly for more than hour it start heating, if charging from 20 to 70 percent back will get heat.Overall this phone is for normal and light user but for techy people, for mobile lovers this is not one plus you can rely on.OnePlus days are gone now, in this price segment even vivo 60 is far better doing than this, there's realme x7 too if we rewlly want that cheap software experience.

Name: Pratik Sharma
Review Title: Review of a long term One Plus user
Review: Our family has One Plus X, 5, 6, 6T and 7. So this one was 6th One Plus phone, and probably our last one.Pros:OS : Simple and SnappyLags: None so farBattery charging: 100% in <30 minLooks are decentCons:1) Speaker quality. It seems that speaker is burst.2) Camera takes blurred photos if there is slight movement of the subject. This is the BIGGEST IRRITATION. Are people supposed to hold their breath?3) No 3.5 mm jackBut overall, I Can't find a difference in my One Plus 5 and this one. What has One Plus done in last 4 years? Stopped innovating completely.

Name: Akash mandal
Review: Bought 1st day, got a defective battery product, then replaced . Using it for 20 days, no issues as such except battery draining a bit faster, and nord 2 isn't as fluid as OnePlus Phones used to be. Even now Original Nord is more fluid than nord 2 , camera very good , but we don't need e 2mp camera instead give a little more battery or headphone jack or atleast give the adaptor. Had to buy it separately. In hand feel awesome display average and speaker is great, front camera needs improvement and should have 4k options, given case is made of great quality. Charging is good. Gaming performance is also good . Ram management poor, total 75 apps(without any games) there but ram free only 2.4gb, needs regular updates. Bought a skin from gadgedshieldz.

Name: Shreyas
Review:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   Ok so its amazing product thing is you don't have 120 Hz refresh rate and some minor glitches and bugs when I try to open BGMI in pro gaming mode it isn't opening and screen flicker issue in Amazon music battery is hell good charging takes 30 minutes camera is mind blowing but the interface is taken from colour OS

Name: DATTA047
Review: Its a good phone. But remind you, megapixels are not everyting. A missing macrolens is a downer. The phone is pretty clean and fast. BGMI at extreme only available at lowest graphics. Heats up a lot while playing genshin impact. The best feature is the 65 watt charger, but battery capacity is pretty low. But I am satisfied. Thanks.

Name: sachin sachdeva
Review: Hi friends, i was using Samsung since very long time and this is my first phone other than samsung. The first impression was good and its been 20 days completed m using this phone and my experience is not very much good as the main issue is accessibility or usage which quite difficult . Also i didnt found any inbuilt app for daily workout like walking, step count ect. Call recording is also with warning only. Battery lasts upto max12 hrs so that is also not so good, although charging is very very fast and impressive but only with one plus warp chrger. With other chargers chaging takes normal time of 45-60 mins to full. While on call sometime its hang up and i 7nable to access other functions during calls that is very big issue. About camera picture quality is good but zoom and other functions are very typical to use. Also the gallery interface is very bad and difficult to see clicked or download pics.I bought 12gb and 256 gb version in 33k with cash back and overall its not value for money. I regreat after purchasing this phone and thete are so many other good options in this price. I decided to use this phone for 10-11 months as I downloaded so many official apps which require approvals and cannot be uninstalled quickly.For others who are planning for this phone, please check some other options also like Oppo reno 6 pro 5 G, samsung 5 G new series.

Name: Siddharth singh
Review: Overall the phone is very good. For me, the camera quality is good and the battery lasts for a day with a single charge. The fast charging charges the phone within 25 minutes. The performance of the device is also good you can play most of the games without any lag. The handiness of the device is best and it is fun to use this phone for reading and along with a 90Hz display, it is a delight for the eyes. One thing I don't like about the device is that it does not provide call recording without announcement and I think it is a software privacy issue and the fingerprint reader does not work even if your fingers are slightly wet. Front-facing camera can be improved. Overall I am happy with the phone in 28k.

Name: Umakanta Jena
Review: Writing review after using this phone from last 15 Days..Prose1. Camera good quality 4 rating2. Touch screen- very good, working properly.. both face lock and finger lock work excellent.3. Display very nice 5 rating4. Charge superb... 💯 % charging within 30 minutes ....5 rating5. Dual speaker working properly 56. Battery life ...not upto mark..3 ratingBig Issue:-Bater drain super fastIf you are normal user then 1 day life.If you are moderate user..2 time required for charging in a day.Havy gammer/ YouTube ... required to change 2-3 time in day...Recommendation:Battery capacity need to be upgrade with higher capacity...

Name: Ashish kumar
Review: Reviewing after a month of use:There were some bugs but with timely update everything is sorted now.This will heats a little while charging and playing high graphic games i.e. PUBG & CODM etc etccamera is totally awesome in dim and sunlight as well.If you can't afford a premium phone then it will be the great option for you.

Name: HV Pavan Hemanth
Review: 1)Camera both front and back are good2)Biometrics (Face and Fingerprint) are very fast3)AMOLED 90Hz Display is Smooth for gaming4) Dual Stereo Speakers. Sound comes from both earpiece and normal speaker.I stopped using my bluetooth speaker after buying this phone.5)65 watt warp Charge. This phone charges from 1to 100 percent within 30 minutes.6) Oxygen OS without any bloatware.I chose this over iphone because:iPhone is too expensive.I do not like notch in iphone. They do not provide charger in box and after we spend money to buy charger , it's charging speed is very slow. OnePlus camera is better than iphone. Iphone has no fingerprint sensor.Iphone does not support physical dual sim , we need to use esim.

Name: GOUTHAM SANKAR
Review: Great for daily use.Good looking and comfy in hands.OS is greatCamera 5/5Battery 5/5Display 5/5 (except the refresh rate)Speaker and sound 5/5NFC - YesWifi Calling - YesFingerprint 5/5Face unlocking 5/5Heating issue - First two days, I was worried about it because of the heating of both phone and adaptor only while charing but later on, it was fine. Haven't experienced any heating issue while using the phone. Since it's 65W charging you must expect some heating while charging which is normalThe main drawback - 120Hz refresh rate is not available at this price rate.

Name: Ambi Tayu
Review: Lastly been waiting for a phone that can be recharged as soon as & Camera can be real...Thanks a lot Amazon for providing me lovely mobile from OnePlus 🥰

Name: Selvabharathi
Review: The main reason I brought this phone because it has more 5g bands and I don't need to switch phone bin next few years.Dimensity 1200 is really optimized well with one plusPerformance is really awesome and very smooth to use.Full charge is done in 37-40minSpeaker are loud and base is really awesome, you don't miss Dolby qualityCamera -- I am a programmer and I don't use this so no commentsI love this OS and security levels added in it.Gammer this phone is not for you, go for snap dragon 888+ phone.Display I don't fell anything odd with it, average point I can give

Name: T BALA SRINIVAS
Review: Hi everyone,. Before I brought this brand mobile I was basically using MI brand for many years, my last phone was poco F1, I lost my poco F1 in a theft, so I was in a hurry to buy mobile.  My friends were using oneplus brand mobile previously and they were quite happy with the oneplus brand performance and camera performance. I have seen the photos of that oneplus brand mobile of my friends and was really happy with the performance of the photos and decided to buy oneplus brand.  I also have a realme x7 mobile in my home so I am comparing this mobile with  realme x7 as well as MI 11 x 5G Pro. The camera of realme x 7 and MI 11 x 5 Pro 5g quite superior and very clear compared to this one I am not happy with the camera performance of this mobile. The battery of  this mobile drains quite fast. The on-screen time when fully charged of this mobile is around only 6 hours. Realme x7 costs less when compared to nord 2. So I would suggest Everyone to buy realme x7 rather than this one which is costing 12000 less

Name: Virender
Review: I've always been a fan of one plus and purchasing the nord2 was an exciting part after using one plus 5 for 4 years.My recommendation to One Plus team is to stick to basics.Missed to mention, it heats like crazy.I charge Nord 2, 2 to 3 times a day. Can you believe that.Not sure what to do now.Rest everything comes after battery.It sucks, literally sucks.I'm writing the review at 2230 hrs and had charged the phone to 100% at 1800 hrs.So in 4 hrs 30 mins, battery remaining is 25%.Call is yours.My recommendation is to go only for core series like 8, 9.........................Review of 9 Nov:I tried to analyse the problem and reduced the screen refresh rate from 90 Hz to 60 Hz. This has helped and battery is bit stable after that but again does not last one full day.Phone is still getting heated up not as much when the refresh rate was 90Hz.My overall recommendation again will be to avoid this phone. You will get much better deals in this range.

Name: Mahammad azeezpasha
Review: Disappointed because Amazon prime not streaming in hd.and display is good but black colour dominating other colours.otherwise overall ok.may be updates are concludes hd streaming and back colour issue

Name: ARUN GOSWAMI
Review: The OnePlus Nord2 phone for me is worth the price. It's surely is an upgrade for me and though I was highly confused with so many reviews about phones in this range, I am glad I went for it.The battery is superb. I am a normal user (don't game much and watch and listen to music at a normal to high level and browse social media platforms every 2-3 hrs). The connectivity is good (bluetooth, wireless and network). I love the VoWiFi option (didn't have on my Oneplus5) and display is superb. Haptics are nice and charging is unbelievably fast. So for regular users like me this is surely an option in the top 2 or3 if you are looking to buy a new phone. OnePlus as a brand  is still worth spending a little extra for as of now.

Name: Unni
Review: Sold after using 3 months after hearing explosion news

Name: Singye Kalon
Review Title: One plus Delivering after a looong time
Review: So I've finally upgraded from my One Plus 5 and the Nord 2 doesn't disappoint. I'm impressed with how good the phone performs and have listed its pros and cons.Pros:Amazing Display: Sure its not 120hz but the 90hz display is still good and its great for multimedia.Processor: The mediatek 1200 Ai is impressive and runs very smoothCamera: Have to say that the camera is impressive and a huge upgrade over that trash One plus previousy sold. It's camera is better than the Mi11x and Iqoo 7.Design: The grey siera matte design is great. It feels really good in hand and is perfect for the minimalist.OS: The OS is smooth, intrusive and easy to understand. Though there has been some changes with the addition with color OSKudos to amazon for its quick delivery.Cons:None so far, maybe the lack of headphones jackTo sum it up, its a great phone at this price point with its camera, os, and performance. For everyday use and multimedia, this phone is perfect. It's about time One plus went back to its roots and have delivered a promising product.

Name: Ashish GT
Review Title: Charging speed fastest I've ever seen
Review: Good Enough, got in good price with old phone replacement cost and HDFC card offer seems best phone in this range rather than Oppo or Vivo and anytime best ever than Samsung.

Name: kishore
Review Title: No HDR support in Amazon prime and netflix
Review: All the features are good except below cons.Cons:1. Mobile is getting heat while using camera2. This mobile is not supporting for HDR video playback in Amazon and netflix OTT3. screen size would have been little large. Mobile width is looking small. As it is 30k price, expected size could be bit large4. Battery is draining little fastPros:1. Battery charging is super fast. Getting full charge on less than 30min2. Camera is good, having more options.3. Display is super.4. Sound quality is also good5. Processor is almost like Snapdragon. I don't feel difference

Name: Milan Kumar Nag
Review: Supperb camera quality.Battery backup is avarage but 65W charger will recharge your mobile in a blink.🔥Overall experience is so premium.I would love to recommend this phone under 30k.

Name: Sanjeev Kumar Boiti
Review Title: A good upper budget smartphone with a lot of cheap parts.
Review: After using it for around 3.5months i'm writing this review. Firstly,i would like to present you some of the pros that you get with your hard earned sweat flow money.1.The Usage- It was really good. Never hanged or never got over-heated. I'm not a heavy user but once played COD for around 1.5hrs but didn't see any significant change in temperature on the back panel nor on the screen and it ran smooth too.2.Battery life- Speaking about the power i must also mention how long it will last but i must say it really works good. In terms of battery if you are a non heavy user you can last upto 1day or even a day and some hours on the next one.3.Charging- This speed is really great and Oneplus does a great job here. You can get 35mins charging time for 1-98% but would recommend to always connect at 30% and disconnect 80-85% to have a long lasting battery .4.Camera- The most deciding factor for many, Oneplus really does a good job here too. The colours are really good and sharpness is also great. The video have a good stabilisation and colours are also great here. At a budget of 30K you can get the best camera.5.Screen- The screen quality is also good and the colours produced are also natural. I like a bit of saturated colours so have set the screen to vivid mode. Playing 4K videos on this screen is great. The brightness levels are also good for outside sun hours usage.6.Sound quality- Speaking the speakers, it really sounds loud and clear. The clarity is great if you use the Dirac Audio Tuner you can also tune according to your need by choosing the presets which really makes a difference on earphones and headphones. Bluetooth earphones doesn't support any kind of tuning from the smartphone.Now, soo much good comes with a lot of unexpected problems that no one could expect from an OnePlus smartphone.Cons:1.Servicing- Oohh,here Oneplus kills my Pros words. First ,after 3months the charging all of sudden started connecting and disconnecting automatically every 10secs and if stood connected would charge really slow say like 2hrs of charging for 20% to 90% and i went to service center for rectification. They said the cable is not working and said to come after 2hrs but after that again he said you come after 1hr and offered me a old cable washed with colin infront of me. The service person still had the audacity to say that this is a new one and asked me that its working or not as if i have asked him free cables . After a bit of quarrel finally he said after 2days it will be in stock and you will get it. After getting a new packed cable the problem still presisted.I went again after 9-10 and they said to change the motherboard and asked me to have a backup of the data on that. Finally the changing of motherboard solved the problem. But Dear Oneplus , if you are reading this is it so that Oneplus started giving up on their motherboards too?The day i got my device back, the alert slider is not working . It would be silent and vibrate but won't come back to general of clicked back and you have to reboot to make it back to General mode. Really Oneplus,Is this what one should expect from you atleast?The company whom i have known to have a great lasting time of around 4-5years and more is doing this to new smartphones?Its now mine also that the alert slider stopped working, my friend's Nord and OP7 also had same problems and they atlast exchanged for a new phone.

Name: Chaitanya
Review: It looks good and camera quality is also good . coming to the processor very good performance.

Name: radha
Review Title: Battery charging is down after usage of one month
Review: I have purchased this mobile in a month ago and every thing ok,now I am facing an issue with battery in the starting days the mobile charging is excellent when I was used all most all social media apps,but now when I keep the charging in the morning it's was down to 30 to 20 % in the same day I called to the cc and explained my problem they initially told some settings and off the mobile and run in safe mode every thing was done but there is no much difference ni found and the cc team saying which app will consume more charging they were asking and the initial days on wards I m using the same apps but that time I haven't faced any Charing down issue after using one month I m facing this issue..I was dispoined..from one plus ..This is the review I have writing after one month usage of mobile

Review: ITS A CORPORATE PHONE I WILL CALL. ITS KIND OF INCOMPLETE ALL ROUNDER I WOULD SAY. I'M A VERY HEAVY USER. CALL QUALITY AND NETWORK IS AWESOME9. BUT IT IS OK.FINALLY I WOULD SAY IF YOU'RE NOT A GAMER AND A MODERATE USER. GO FOR NORD 2 BLINDLY 8 + 128 IS SUFFICIENT IN MY OPINION..

Name: Ayan
Review: Been using this for a month now and happy with the experience.Assured security and OS updates with a near native Android experience minus bloatware was my primary requirement. This phone gives all of it and more.The phone goes from 40% to 100% in about 15 minutes, and that's one feature I love - no need to put the phone on charge overnight. The phone charges fully while I finish my breakfast.Fingerprint sensor works in a jiffy, a distinct improvement from OnePlus 6T I have been using for last 3 years. The camera works great for me. I am not a gamer so cannot comment on the gaming aspects.Also it's lightweight and slim, and the speakers work just great.In summary a great choice at the price from OnePlus.

Name: Pratik Kumar Sahu
Review Title: Initial product review: OnePlus Nord 2 5G (Go For It)
Review: Initial impression is good. Lot of granting permission in the beggining which might seems bit irritating.Apps getting crashed during uses due to storage issue.Little bit of heating issue was there at the beginning but now it is totally fine.There were some issue related to storage..everytime getting message : 'Clean up storage to download the apps from play store'.Even with all the glitches after doing one Factory Reset..everyting working fine now.Main Camera quality is crystal and mind-blowing. Front camera may be bit hazzy but still it do the work after some adjustment.Battery life is working quite well..played COD for more than an hour and battery consumption was only 18%. Pretty much does the work.No lag during game play.Overall UI is awesome.Value for money 💸💰..

Name: Aji Apra
Review Title: Pocket mode not working at all
Review: Based on previous good experience with OnePlus bought this one ( even though it's from china!!).Now, i bought, set up, switched from old phone to this phone. Thought all sorted. I realised random calls were going, messages were getting sent etc. It's due to pocket mode not working !!Called customer care. They asking me to bring the phone for repair and it will take two weeks.Ridiculous. Please don't buy oneplus. This is simply not acceptable. They should've given a replacement phone and sold this as refurbished.

Name: sohan pawar
Review Title: Battery backup, design and camera is key features for this
Review:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   Pros and cons after 1 month of use...1) Main camera is good, but u can't do touch to focus, focusing done only with camera sensor we can't do it touch to focus.2) Wide angle camera is not so good, it doesn't have stabilization.3) After 15-20 min of camera use you'll get overheating warning and then until phone get's to its idle temperature you can't use it.4) Battery backup I don't have any complaints, I am using it majorly for photography and gaming purpose, after 2 hrs of BGMI (PUBGM) gaming battery drains only 20-30%.5) If it comes to charging speed, you keep phone on charge and until you'll come back after bathing it charges fully... It means 25-30 mins it takes to charge 100%.6) Because of plastic and glass design device feels hot immediately.7) Front camera is just like 15k mobile camera, but I don't need it so no prob for me.8) OS is butter smooth with 90fps.*That's it guys, for photography clarification, check added clicks and follow me on instagram for new clicks and tutorials of Nord 2...❣️*

Name: Kunal C.
Review: I have been a big oneplus fan. Used their one plus 5 for 4 years. Never had any problems no lag, no problem of hanging, good battery life and a great camera quality. Then I started facing some software issues and bugs so I decided it was time to move on with times and get the one plus nord 2. It's been almost a month since I have been using this phone. And WHAT A LET DOWN. Horrible camera clarity. The brand seems to have regressed interms of its camera. I have never been so disappointed with a phones camera. And over all usability is also not very smooth despite the fact that I have a 12/256GB varient. The display clarity is also below average and a let down. Doesn't feel like a fluid amoled display at all. Video quality on 360p seem poorer than they should. Over all I would like to give them a ZERO especially for the camera, the screen quality and over all usability. Please don't waste your money. Might aswell buy the iPhone 11

Name: Harjot Singh
Review: I'm a 1+ fan and I had used 1+1,1+3 and then 1+6 and now I bought 1+Nord2. This phone is excellent but thing is 1+ oxygen OS is the reason I liked 1+ products. But in Nord2 I have to face some downgrades in OS like there is an Google dialer in this phone insted of OnePlus own dialer and same this happens with the messanger too which I hated most . Although I have no problem with changed camera UI because 1+ camera UI is not that great. Plus there were also not that much customisation as compared to my 1+6 but still this Nord device really performing well and works really smooth.

Name: Lingaraj K P
Review: Hard earned money spent on a waste mobile. I don't say I'm a big fan of Samsung but you get what you are looking for within your range. But this is completely disappointed me. Now I'm realizing I should have gone for a high end mobile from Samsung or a basic Mobile from Apple. I'm not at all thrilled to hold this mobile. Never again in my life. Samsung I'm extremely sorry.

Name: Raaz
Review: Update:Pros: Good looking slim phone,display great. battery backup is very good.Sound output is amazing.Cons: Not expandable. I feel camera is ok not great, better to go for vivo x60/70 series for camera.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review: This is the second time in the last one and a half month when my phone got self locked and it's allowing only receiving calls and dialing emergency numbers. OnePlus customer care is completely deaf about the issues raised. Have again raised a pickup request for repair. Now it will come with a factory reset so, all data will be lost again.  There seems to be a software issue which OnePlus isn't able to fix. Final message for all: Never Settle for OnePlus Nord 2.

Name: Ravindra Prabhu
Review: Well the phone is great. No two words about it. I switched over from a Poco F1 and this is what I felt is missing in the Nord 2 - automatic call recorder. I work in a job that requires me to take a lot of client calls and I record most of them for my reference to execute the work. This was never a problem with the poco F1 but the Nord 2 has Google dialer and make an announcement when you manually hit record and that spooks the other person. Next is the size of the phone, it's a bit taller than my old poco F1. There is no reason for a phone to be imagined as a phablet. A phone goes into our pocket and goes everywhere with us, so it should be handy. Manufacturers need to get over their obsession of making bigger phones.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review: This is my first One Plus phone and I'm two minds about it, it's been over a week of usage now, some places it has impressed me and some places it js straight up disappointing. I just noticed that it has stopped fast charging, I don't know why. It was working till today morning and today evening I decided to charge my phone and it took 3 hours to full charge, the battery is draining relatively quickly as well. There is no gaming mode in this phone so gamers please don't buy this phone, unless you want pop up interfering with your gameplay. The only good (decent) part about this phone would be camera which is decent for the price. Apart from that, idk, wouldn't recommend you to buy this phone. Can go for an Iqoo 7 instead. Bought that as well, worth every buck

Name: ankit b.
Review Title: A kind of premium flagship killer
Review: Overall the phone is quite outstanding.Camera is amazing (but that OnePlus camera app missing , you get a color os camera app which is just ok)Battery is satisfactory. For me it lasts about 18 19 hrs (which includes around 1 hr of gaming playing call of duty and vlash of clan)with a screen on time of 5-6 hrs which is decent.Charging is mesmerizing 🤩. 0 to 100 in 31mins. This is the best part of this phone. Drain it as much as you can and charge it for just 15 min you will get enough to sustain 5 6 hrsCall quality is good with proximity sensor properly workingStereo speakers will amaze you. Best i would say in this price.Screen experience vould have been even better we get 120 hz display but 90hz is ok.

Name: Sreejith & Lakshmi
Review Title: Recommended, if you could live without a 2.5mm headphone jack
Review: Enough had already been said by others that by now you must be knowing all the pros and cons of this device. It is not a mind boggling phone or a design benchmark , but a very good phone that fits most of the pockets, figuratively. It perfectly suits my daily needs- reading news, messaging, video calls , banking ....4 to 5 hours of screen time every day . Yes, it does tend to heat up, noticed while updating apps in a go and while making prolonged video calls. I keep the WiFi  and the mobile data on always, bluetooth off and with my usual usage 25-30% charge will be left by night. It doesn't have a 'monster' battery that lasts 2-3 days on single charge, but who needs that when you could charge the phone to 85% in 10 minutes , thanks to warp charging. And when you plug-in your device late in the night, it detects and switch itself to optimized night charging mode. Not an ardent photographer, but the photos taken were crisp and bright. Low light photography was also great. Not a fan of onscreen finger print scanner, but there is no lag in unlocking . Even face unlock works like a charm. Another plus point, in my perspective, is that the device is very handy and light weighted too. I don't know anything about the 5G capabilities and the so called band controversies, I am happy with what I got. Ask me, I would say you should buy this, if your average screen usage is less than 5 hours a day , not a hardcore gamer and if you don't have to take an emi or loan to buy this phone. Thank you for putting through

The media could not be loaded.
                




   Worst optical image stabilization while recording videos. Superfast charging. Cheap amoled display & bad battery backup. Small screen size. Name: AJAY VISHNU
Review: 1. Overheating issue!  Phone heat like oven, while using camera/video it feels like its gonna explode soon. that much of heat  coming out from the phone.2. Mist coming around camera.!!  After say 5-10 mts of usage, there's a cloud of mist coming inside the camera, and after that, all the  pics we take look blurry.  I've attached the photo of it. have a look at it3. Lame Customer care!!  I made a complaint to customer care, and they couldn't solve the issue, they said they had to change the  motherboard and ruined the phone completely. I won't recommend this crap phone to anyone, Don't waste your hard  earned money on it.

Name: Shivam
Review Title: not a value for money product, expected better camera and battery life
Review: I'm writing this review after using the mobile for a month. This is my very honest opinion.Earlier I was using Redmi Note 5 Pro. The main reason I bought this product for its processor and camera. My review might contain some comparison b/w my last low budget phone (10k-20k) to this mid budget phone (20k -35k).Pros:1. No ads2. Super Fast charging is very good: With in-box charger, it took half an hour for full charge. But this will only work with oneplus warp charger. The mobile also supports slow charging (better for battery life) with in-box charger, but there is no option to use/set it manually, it is auto, mostly at night time.3. Night mode works good, just you need to hold it for 4 seconds.4. Primary rear camera is very good, but other two rear cameras are just for display.5. 90 Hz display is good.6. Small onscreen button in corner for screen rotate function which appears automatically in bottom when it is needed.7. Slider to change to ring/vibrate/silent. A nice feature.8. The processor is fast enough for me, but I can't say for others as I'm not heavy gamers or video editor.9. UFS 3.1 storage is fast for file transfer b/w pc and mobile10. Onscreen fingerprint is more convenience.Cons:1. Battery life is short. For normal users, you might need to charge it twice. So I think it is not suitable for travelling.2. Selfie camera is 32M, but selfie photos looks like low budget phones. BIG disappointment for me.3. Secondary rear camera can be better. Third (2M) rear camera is useless.4. Boot time is high.5. Peak brightness is low. Only issue if you stay in sunlight for longer time.6. Although there are no ads, but you can not remove pre-installed google apps. like youtube (okay for me), youtube-music, google duo, google play movies, google photos. I would prefer to remove them.7. App clone is sh*t compared to what I used in my last Redmi phone. Only support for few apps like whatsapp, facebook, telegram, but also I cannot access their data folder. I need to access my cloned whatsapp folder which I used to backup data to my laptop using USB cable in case needed.8. Sometimes it hangs too. I noticed it when using the camera. I hope they fix it with future update.9. Calling app is not good.  a. warning for call record, tried multiple apps but nothing works; also other Oneplus phones are snapdragon based, so their apk can not be installed in Mediatek based nord-2 . now I have stopped using call recording.  b. if you use video call feature( which can be used when calling b/w same sim operator), you won't like it. very small round block of your video (you can not know exactly what other is seeing) and that too is fixed in left corner. Cannot hide it or focus on it,  c. if phone gets locked while calling, you cannot use fingerprint till you are in call as no option to see onscreen fingerprint sensor to place your finger. You can only use calling function else you need to cut call and unlock and then call again.10. I feel in-built apps like Gallery, file manager and others have very limited and basic function.11. whenever I try to access my whatsapp folder, it takes significant time to show content of my images/videos in whatsapp media folder. That was not the case with my last redmi phone. Both whatsapp are of same size (6GB).12. Once I gave my bluetooth earphone to service center. I felt mobile should have 3.5mm jack, also oneplus type-c wired earphone are too costly (Rs 1300) where as you can get 3.5mm good earphone in Rs 500.I hope it would help others to make a good decision.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review: Now a days anyone fight for their investment. At the rate of 30k OnePlus Nord should perform better than other competitors. People don't need brand. They need quality with their investment. OnePlus satisfied but not surprised. I'm giving overall verdict that best performer with best built quality of phone and charger but not battery. Roughly used mobile users are not preferred this cute mobile. But it's preferred like psychopaths.

Name: GK
Review Title: Excellent Mobile Phone - Oxygen OS fans find some difference
Review: Pros: 6GB/128GB Variant1. Excellent display without any tint issue like other AMOLED display2. Build quality is good but always glass is a glass, rear will easily break even-though Gorilla Glass 5 if you dropped at a small distance. Use with case to avoid scratches and to manage unforeseen drop.3. Stero-speaker is loud enough compared with the same mid-range of devices4. Much better camera optics compared with OnePlus 9R and OnePlus first generation Nord device, picture quality is very good in both day-light and night mode5. No heating issues observed even-though squeezing the phone through multi-task using many apps6. Google meet, Zoom calls and Slack/Huddle calls of both Audio & Video working flawlessly for quite long time without facing any heating complaints7. Battery backup is good in which SOT getting around 6HRS to 7HRS which is fair enough in this segment8. Charging speed - no words to highlight here as everyone aware the power of warp charge with 65 watts adapter9. Finger-print is speed enough which is far better than any Samsung mid-range devices10. Voice clarity is excellent - using both Jio and Airtel11. Voice over Wi-Fi working flawless if the bandwidth is enough or else facing minor lag in the opponent voice12. Picking network signals is very good compared with few Mi phones in the same network zone13. Same case for picking Wi-Fi signal compared with other mid-ranger smartphones (Wi-Fi 6 supported)14. Network Aggregation kicked-off without any issue, able to see increase in the download speed from 19mbps to 30mbps  - Kudos to Mediatek Dimensity 1200 AI15. No issues in touch sensitive of this AMOLED display which is very good16. Form-factor and weight balance is nice, which is easy to hold in hands compared with other 6.4+ inches mobile devicesCons:1. Minor change in the OxygenOS which is now acts as a wrapper UI because of core code base is changed to ColorOS from their parent company of Oppo (Little bit long list start from battery section to permission section)2. Sometimes facing minor issue in proximity sensor - not all the times3. Auto-brightness taking brightness to low level sometimes4. Always on display is taking battery consumption upto 5% to 7% additional juice

Name: MOZAMMIL ANSARI
Review Title: Think before purchase, Is only Brand Name enough for Purchase
Review: I am Realme XT (Snapdragon 720) user from last 02 year, after accidental damage of my phone, I go with huge Brand Name OnePlus, phone color, look is simply awesome, but battery drain is so fast after 30 mint of simple insta and Amazon my battery is 98-68, if u are multipurpose or heavy user then U have to charge ur phone at least 2 time and some time 3 times , and phone hitting is really serious issue, Only use of YouTube or Insta u can feel phone heat at the external cover

Name: Ankur Thakur
Review Title: Best than the others in this price range
Review: I've been a OnePlus user for 4 years now. This purchase is my upgrade from 5T.Here is my review after three weeks of use:- Rear camera is surely good, the night mode feature is just amazing. It's better than a lot of other smart phones in this bracket.- Front camera is only 8MP and hence isn't that great.- Battery life isn't huge. Although my usage is heavy, but not extremely heavy, still it lasts 1.5 days only. It could have been better. Fast charging feature is just out of this world. It takes only 30-35 minutes to get your phone fully charged from zero which is just amazing- screen refresh rate is very good and the display is as smooth as it gets- rest all other features are similar to my previous OnePlus 5T, nothing new in thereOverall, it's a good buy and from my past experience of using OnePlus, I can definitely say that this phone will last for at least 3-4 years with you.

Name: SharathUpadya
Review: The best out therr.. just don't go by specs, the feel is great, i had used OnePlus 3 in the past.1. No heating issue2. Display is crisp 90Hz is smooth.3. Phone is Fast, you won't feel any lag4. Aah camera, the sony sensor sucks all the light into it. Trust me nord 2 has the best low light camera out there in the segment.5. Warp charge is crazy, 10-90% in 13 minutes, its insane.6. Oxygen Os is the best clean OS, yeah they are migrating to color Os, yet the feeling is great.(that's y 4 🌟 else this one deserves 5 🌟)

Name: Aanal shah
Review: Price: Bought on republic day with instant discount of ₹3,000 so actual price is ₹27,000.Phone weight : even though it's 190g it doesn't feel that.Display : i always looking for small display size, my previous phone was redmi note 7 pro, but compare to that even though screen size slightly larger than that phone but I don't have any problem. Display color is awesome, no complaints.Camera : main back camera is the main thing which is excellent. Even though I like front camera also but some of my friends is not happy.Battery : i was concerned about battery life but it's also more than sufficient for day usage. Be aware while charging phone it's just take only 14 minutes from 15% to 100%, charger is very fast.You can't insert memory card in this phone.Overall best phone of if you are looking to switch in premium brand.

Review: I have using this nord 2 for past  six days I can say the performance of this phone is good but not class leading when I played asphalt 9 i noticed several frame drops at high quality settings also 60 fps is not available in asphalt 9 .In terms of pubg the phone performes decent enough.At first when I received the mobile it has some heating issu but after three days of uses the  isuu got fixed automatically I don't know how it's happened and about the UI I don't know why they giving Google dialer and massaging app u just can't record any secret conversation and the flotting animation of that massaging app is trash it's so jittery . The fingerprint sensor of this phone is avarage , camera quality is good ,battery life is decent  overall a decent phone.

Name: Pawan Ramesh Chavhan
Review Title: 100 % rich and premium phone... In budget segment.. ❤️🔥🤗
Review: #Display 10/10🔥 ❤️ Battery life 10/10 🔥❤️ charging 10/10🔥 ❤️💯processer 10/10🔥 ❤️Gaming 10/10🔥❤️💯Wifi with 5g connectivity 🔥❤️💯dizine and build quality 10/10 🔥 camera quality + video quality 10)10.🔥😁 and the one of the best part of the phone is the 65w charger charge your phone 0 to 100% within 30 min I use the phone around 6 months even today also I use the phone 🤳 but never I face the heating issue or some of lagging in the phone speaker quality 10/10 🔥🔥🔥 💯the speaker come with stereo so don't worry the loudness and the bass is subberb the phone is 🤑 rich look and thik as in mension on website you buy the phone without any confusion🤗💯

Name: VJS
Review: WELCOME POSITIVES:-All departments are good.-Never settle drop down features are great. -Excellent build and sleek looking.-Awesome stereo speakers, hi-fi sound in premium earphones.-Clear and crisp calls management-Good and competing with similar class-Ultimate battery (24hrs 4 casual users👍game freaks excuse 7 to 8hrs only)DRAW BACKS:-No SD card (but use OTG devices),-No 3.5mm Jack (but use adapter)-No 120Hz refresh rate only 90hz, yet video enhancement features lifting outputs of YouTube, Amazon Prime & Netflix-No 4k video recording but Gcam supporting 4k Ultra High resolution-In screen finger print response is quick-Irritating permissions could've been avoided by company.Summing all it is a feature-rich phone, worthwhile and having good VFM

Name: Sathya Prakash Moparthi
Review Title: Best in segment (if you don't want bloatware)
Review: If you are not a hardcore gamer and know what to expect from OnePlus brand, then this is the best in the segment.Coming to the Oxygen OS merge with Color OS, if you are not aware, even older devices like OP6 received the same updates (minus camera improvements) and it is much much better than the bloatware shoved in Mi/RealMe/IQOO devices.Camera is decent (all thanks to the decent sensor) but there is room for improvement in processing.You wont feel the battery to be inadequate thanks to the fast charger.Elephant in the room: Heating issue. Yes, if you use your device while charging or do hardcore gaming, heating is definitely noticeable (a lot).I have purchased this mobile for my mother and she is happy with the overall device, camera, screen brightness, charging speed, gaming capabilities. So If you are not a hardcore gamer, go for it.

All other stuff of phone usage is butter smooth.battery is little less...goes on a day but the charger is the best ever thing with this. Juices up in no time. Great job OnePlus Hope it remains the same as well. At this price range video quality is super cool and the day to day usage and ram management is top notch. Extraordinary performance with games as well. If the blast news isn't spread. Then this order would be the best smartphone of the year. But hope all becomes safe and secure.Hope so

Speakers are good...loud volume.....good bakance of base and treble.5. Software is good...no bloatware.....but it should be pure oxygen OS... missing that feel little bit.6. Slider button is an add-on....Cons....1. Battery life while idle needs to improve.2. Cameras needs updates.....both are good at some point..but not consistent........ needs improvement specially front.3.RAM management can be improved.Now at last one plus please do something about  Nord 2 blast. Name: Chirag Narang
Review Title: Good Phone Overall with Average Battery Backup
Review: I was initially looking for One Plus 9R but ended up buying One Plus Nord2 as both have similar features and costing of Nord2 is almost Rs. 10k cheaper.Pros-1. Good Processor2. 65W fast charging3. Fingerprint reader also very good4. Good SpeakerOverall functioning is quite good but I personally didn't like the battery backup. Its almost same as One Plus 6 which I was using earlier. Also it does not have Headphones jack

Name: Rickson
Review Title: I've been using it for 4 months, here's what I think
Review: Yes OnePlus has changed the OS, but it doesn't make a difference to you, let's start.1. You'll fall in love with the display and the battery charge speed.2. Initially there was a bad lag everytime I opened my phone, but apparently after I gave location permission to accessory settings, it was smooth as butter. (It might be because of the updates too)3.camera quality is okay. I had a RealmeX with me before, that took better photos.4. No overheating, i charge it near my bed, used to get scared initially, when the blast news was there, but eventually my attitude went to mehh5.Overall, good package as a phone. Basic functions are perfect. I'm a practicing doctor and this phone never has let me down when I needed it the most!

Name: sharath kumar vaidya
Review Title: Don't buy any mobile on Amazon platform..
